Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Zayden_B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend and the hotel was beautiful! The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and gorgeous. However, all the employees are rude and they talk about u in Spanish. They thought I didn't understand them but I'm half Mexican and know Spanish fluently. Every time u call guest services and ask for something, they either don't bring it or bring it the next day. The receptionist stopped me on my way to my room and stated that they received complaints from other guests saying we were to loud. I know this was false because we hadn't been in our room ALL day! They wanted pick on us because we didn't 'look' like we belong. While checking out, the receptionist charged my card wrong and it took them a whole week to correct it. The hotel was beautiful but they need a whole new staff. I will NEVER stay here after being treated so poorly

Reviews.Title: “Clean but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: fareesha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and althought the hotel looked spotless there were some minor hiccups and one major one for me that will make me not go back. Upon entering the hotel there was noone to greet us so we walked straight up to the counter where the attendant never even bothered to look up and greet us. I said Hi and at the same time the phone rang and she said excuse me and took the call. I work in customer service and I know this is a major NO-NO. Anyway we were given our room keys and headed up to our room in an elevator that sounded like it veryyy old when compared to the rest of the hotel. The room itself was very cosy but rather small. It was suitable for my husband and I but I can see that some people would say it was too small. The car park had ample spaces and the hotel itself is located in an isolated area. I saw a subway about 5 mins walk away but most other eating places were at least 5-10 minutes away. One night when we got back there was a stench that made you run into the hotel as fast as you can as it was so putrid. We had a breakfast inclusive rate and had breakfast for all three days - this is the reason why I said something major happened for me to not want to go back. Every morning that we went there were dirty tables. The menu ranges with not much options for vegetarians so one day we ordered the BLT egg sandwich without the bacon and halfway through it we found pieces of bacon - needless to say my husband ran to the bathroom to vomit as this goes against our religion. For this reason we will not go back as we were not even apologised to, instead we were asked if we wanted another one made. Also if you are going ask for a room away from the road as you can hear traffic passing and we were on the 5th floor. Pool and Gym was also small but available. The hotel itself was okay but I had a bad experience and this is why I am saying I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you are traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EdgarSGuatemala
Reviews.Content: Talking about value for your money! I was looking for a convenient not expensive hotel in the Miami area (not near the beaches or downtown) and I booked this Courtyard. I was not dissapointed. The facility looks new, the service is simple and convenient. Do not come here if you dont have a car. The rooms are not big but enough for a convenient stay. Excellent choice if you are traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ACMik
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights before our caribean cruise trip and wanted to stay somewhere out of downtown so we can make some trips easily. This hotel is pretty close to a highway, looks new, rooms are very well furnitured and clean. Price doesn't include breakfast, but you can buy one easily on the bar (can take some time when full of people). Parking is all around and looks safe. All the people were very nice and helpful. We have decided to return here after our voyage.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colucci98
Reviews.Content: Very clean - nice staff - the beds however, were not the most comfortable although OK for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you need to be in the area - less so for tourists”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: I was working in the office park area surrounding this Courtyard so the location was ultra-convenient. It is a long way to anywhere else, however. The nearby freeway is toll and the surface streets are slow. My king room was rather small but the bathroom was quite spacious. This appears to be a newer property so everything was sleek, modern and in good physical condition. The bed was comfortable but the covers were a little thin. There was no closet, but there was an integrated work desk/TV stand/armoire. The armoire was rather small and I had difficulty hanging all of the clothes I brought that had fit into carryon luggage. The work desk was right in front of the HVAC unit and could get drafty. The TV was a flat-screen, but the only HD channels were for the local channels. The other cable channels (including HBO) were in standard-def. The free wired internet (wireless is also available) ranged from adequate-for-email (I measured 0.6 mbs) to unusable on a couple of the evenings I was there. There is an on-site restaurant ("Bistro") which offers breakfast in the mornings and some light fare along with beer and wine in the evenings. Service was really spotty and the staff tended go get flustered very easily. This was unfortunate because there is not much other dining nearby and what's there is scattered about and hard to find. There is the Dolphin Mall, about 6 miles away (10 minutes by toll road, 20 minutes by surface streets) where there is a cluster of chain restaurants. I would definitely stay here again - but only for working in the same nearby office.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: kicam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newer & the rooms were very clean! However the location leaves a little to be desired, sort of in a business district. You have to travel several exits north or south to find places to eat or shop, not really that big of deal, the hotel and friendly staff make up for the inconvenient location. The only negative I would mention, is that maids came to early & were loud out in the hallway (usually around 9:30am) ok I guess if you are there for business, not ok if there for pleasure. Other than that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel.....looking forward for next visit"”
Reviews.Author: Sedena2011
Reviews.Content: We returned from our trip on Friday Nov. 25th after spending five nights at the Courtyard. This is a newer hotel with beautifully decorated rooms. The check in was very quick and Malay who was on that night was very friendly. Our room was very clean, and was cleaned every day regardless of what time we left. We cannot comment on the food because we eat out daily. Laundry facility with coin operated machines are offered which was great. Please note that it would be best to have a car while staying at this location. It's about a ten minute drive to food and shopping, which did not matter to us. But, nothing within walking distance, but they do have a shuttle. Of course we cannot forget Raees who also works the reception/check-in desk. We had the opportunity of interacting with him on more than one occasion. He was the one to make us feel the most at home. He always found the time to find out if everything is okay, and if we needed anything. Most of all he made full eye contact while communicating with us which is extremely important. To be honest we feel that some of the other front desk receptionist could learn something positive from Malay and Raees. Overall we had a great time and would highly recommend this location to others. Sorry we forgot out cameras so no pictures, However, please note that this hotel, lobby, rooms etc. are exactly the same as in the advertised pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business”
Reviews.Author: owltmaz
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel with modern decor. Friendly staff. Has a nice fitness center and the roads near by a perfect for a run. Like all Courtyards, you pay for breakfast. You will also need a car, since there is no place to eat with in walking distance, unless you eat in the limited menu lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: ursinegrouch
Reviews.Content: If you're lucky enough to happen by, you'll find yourself at a great little hotel. It's a newer Marriott Hotel and not used and abused like so many others; it's actually hard to find and I'm lucky to use it when family gets together in Doral and we need an inexpensive place to bed down. The pool and hot tup are empty so relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Serviceâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: 576Martin
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve being staying here about once a monthâ€¦ One person that standout is Milay. I donâ€™t know how she remembers me with so many people coming in and out on a regular basis like I do but she does. Whenever I have a question, request a particular room or simply wanting to share my road experiences she's always very attentive. I have seeing Milay interact with other customers and she definitely careâ€¦ Overall, the whole staff is very friendly and willing to help. Compared to all the hotels I stay on a regular basis this is the best; my compliments to the GM, Ms. Fernandez.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and good staff”
Reviews.Author: hospitablegirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a very nice man. He was so awesome and polite. The rooms are amazing! The room was large and the bed was comfortable. My only complaint is that the lady at the desk in the morning was rudely yelling at a guest on the phone. Other than that, the stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “New and clean!”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveller_Joe
Reviews.Content: New, clean rooms. Starbucks on-site breakfast can be slow and repetitive for long stays. No dinner options anywhere nearby. You're marooned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with access to Fort Lauderdale and Miami.”
Reviews.Author: mattwil
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel which is convenient to Fort Lauderdale and Miami. It is clean, new, and the hotel staff is very helpful. It is reasonably priced and worth a stay, especially if you are doing business in more than one city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy999
Reviews.Content: It is a brand new hotel located just off Florida's Turnpike, with a contemporary decor throughout. Staff was courteous and helpful. The only down side is that it is not close to any tourist attractions, which wasn't a concern to us and shouldn't be a concern to any traveler with a car.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Move Ever”
Reviews.Author: OliveTraveling
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch! Great value, off the beaten path, trendy, & excellent customer service. We ended up here after a very bad night in the Howard Johnson Plaza 10 minutes away. We made the call that morning & spoke to Milay who was awesome. We checked out of the HJ in our pajamas and went straight to the courtyard. The manager on duty, Melissa, was also great. The hotel is a new hotel. It has an interactive traveler's board where you can find out things from the weather to the score of last night's game. For you Starbuck's Lovers, there is one right in the hotel! The lobby, the lounge area, business center, flight center for printing boarding passes, the laundry room, & pool area were all top notch amenities. There's a refrigerator but no microwave. The night clerk offered to warm the food for us in the eating area if need be. The room was spacious and comfortable. Free wifi that was quick. Free & plentiful parking. The hotel itself was extremely quiet. Driving distance is reasonable to anywhere in Miami. 20 minutes from Sawgrass, 30 minutes from the Washington Ave strip, 30 minutes from Coconut Grove. We took the streets back to the airport and arrived within 20 minutes. No stress from the freeway and it would've been the same amount of time. It's a great value and it will be my hotel of choice EVERY time I return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “WAY above average in everything; location works well by FL Turnpike”
Reviews.Author: LadyDi34743
Reviews.Content: Exceptional room cleanliness, comfortable beds, tons of pillows, great attitude from ALL staff personnel. Traveling with Senior Citizens parents, aunts etc I wanted to ensure they would not have nothing to "nitpick". I made the right decision on this lodging since visiting relatives in Miami Beach and staying in Miami Beach was out of the question due to the OUTRAGEOUS rates there. This Marriott is fairly new and it still gleams from top to bottom. The "GoBoard" was cool high tech and quite informative of local events. The Bistro served decent drinks and good, fresh food served with competence by the professional staff. The business/media lounge was state of the art. The outdoor patio and pool area spotless and welcoming. Returning to Kissimmee the next day was a snap with the FL Turnpike exit just a scant 3 minutes from the hotel driveway. This is considered the "boonies" by Miamians but just perfect for traveling off and on the Turnpike. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to other travellers! Keep up the good work! :>>

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel - Right Off Turnpike But Near Nothing Else!”
Reviews.Author: Melb33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight before completing our trip to Key West. As other have said, the hotel is in the middle of an industrial/business park, so do not book it unless you are aware that the closest sit down restaurants (other than a grungy Denny's) is located an exit or two away at the Dolphin Mall. If, however, you are looking for a place to rest your head overnight, that's convenient to the highway - this is your place!!! We used our Marriott Reward points and, contrary to what others have posted, we were greeted graciously by the gray-haired woman at the front desk. She was pleasant and welcoming, so no problems for us with her! Our room was on the top floor and was the nicest room we'd stayed out during our travels! The bed was out of this world!!! Large comfortable king with plenty of dreamy pillows! The room was clean and, of course, the first thing I did was look at the mattress and am happy to report no bedbugs! The bathroom was spacious and we were given plenty of towels. Nice water pressure as well! If I had one little bitty negative, it would be no complementary breakfast. There is a bistro in the lobby which we did not try. However, we would stay at this Courtyard again in a heartbeat! Note, that the southern portion of the Florida Turnpike is now cashless (no toll booth attendants). This means you must either have a Sunpass or they will "toll-by-plate," so no need to worry about the exit being Sunpass Only any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice fairly new hotel off FL turnpike”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new Courtyard with a nice expanded lobby, bar area, etc. The king bed room we had on the 5th floor was spacious and the bathroom was nice. It met our expectations as having stayed at many Courtyards. The location is a bit far from any tourist attractions, etc. It was about a 10 min drive to either Burger King, McDonalds Starbucks and Denny's. Not bad, just keep it in mind before returning to the hotel at night. If using the FL turnpike it is best to have a SunPass as coming to the hotel from the north the exit only takes SunPass, so fyi. Other than that it was a nice hotel. Didn't get to use the pool, to cold but the pool area did look nice and was stocked with towels. If you need to be in this area of Miami, this is a good hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and very clean. But its in the middle of nowhere and service is lousy”
Reviews.Author: miamiskyboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Miami/West for one night only. I arrived late in the evening of January 9th, 2011. I was greeted by a very nice evening manager who assisted me with check in. I am a Silver Elite member of the Marriott Rewards Program. But I was not welcomed back, I was not issued key cards that recognized me for being an Elite member and when I asked to have a room on the 5th floor I was told they were :"very full tonight" and basically. Gave me whatever she wanted. Despite the customer service failures, this hotel does deliver on comfort, cleanliness and style. The rooms here are nicer then at many of the older full service Marriotts and the bathrooms have a certain luxury feel to them. The lobby is the new signature Courtyard lobby and in this particular rendition of it. Has been executed to perfection. Giving the feel that you are at a much more expensive hotel. I did use the fitness center and it was clean and well equipped. I did not use the pool or hot tub. But they seemed very nice and they had plenty of fresh towels available. It is important to note that this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. In a corporate park of the Florida Turnpike. There is NOTHING to eat, do, or shop within at least a 5 minutes driving distance. And I am being generous !!! Furthermore, the hotel cafe closes at 10PM. They do have a market where you can get snacks. But the market was poorly stocked when I was there and 1/2 of the items that should of been there were not. So I did not have much of a selection. It was pretty bad. They had some TV dinners, but one of them was open and sitting in the refrigerator and the whole display just did not look clean. I did not want to drive in Miami at 2AM so I did what I could with the selections that were available. My room was next to a screaming baby and a family with kids that would not stop crying all night. When I called downstairs to resolve. I was told there was nothing they could do for me because the property was full. Breakfast was ok I guess. This is the new Courtyard bistro style breakfast. So there is no longer a buffet. I felt like I was at a factory. The service was very impersonal. You basically choose and pay for your item at the bar. Then they give you a number and within minutes the item arrives at your table. Presentation was not that great and the potatoes were super greasy. The only orange juice option that they offer is the cheap minute maid variety and it was not cold ??? So i had to request a glass of ice. At the end of the day my egg's, toast and coffee were $13.00 and for the price I think the Courtyard failed to deliver. The next day I called to see if I could extend my check out for 1 hour. As this is never been a problem before when I have asked in the past. Usually for Elite members they always grant you that courtesy. Not here !!! I had to speak to the GM (Laura Fernandez) to finally get them to give me the extra hour that I needed. She acted is is she was doing me a huge favor and seemed annoyed that I was asking. "We have a big group coming in" she said. Unless you are visiting one of the big corporations that are in the corporate park or in the area. I would not stay here. There are plenty of other options in the Doral area or Airport area that are closer to food, shopping and things to do. It is also important to know that the entrance to the FLA Turnpike which is adjacent to the hotel. Is a sunpass lane only. So, if you are a tourist and don't have electronic toll capability. Be careful you do not get a violation !

Reviews.Title: “Too far out! Save your $50 for a cab ride to the airport and get a closer hotel to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jkfoster713
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but nothing near it! It has a complimentary shuttle that will take you or pick you up within a 5 mile radius of the hotel or two the Dolphin Mall ( which is 8 miles away). If you took a cruise you can take a bus for 2 dollars over the bridge if you can disimbarke before 9 and then walk to the bus stop for bus number 7. Take the one bus 7 that goes to Dolphin mall for another 2 dollars. Once there you can call the hotel to pick you up at the entrance marked with a 3. The downfall is that the bus ride will take you about 1 1/2 hours and the hotel doesn't have a sign on it's shuttle. So look for a mini van. If you don't use any of the public transit it will cost well over $60-70 to take a taxi! To get to the airport from the hotel it cost us $50! Spend this money on the Courtyard Airport Hotel that has a free shuttle and you can take the same bus, number 7, and stop a few blocks from this hotel. Plus the bus ride is only 45 minutes from downtown. The service wasn't very good. I agree with a previous review of the older white haired lady. She wasn't very nice. Then in the morning I asked for them to call a taxi. Instead they already ordered a shuttle for another family and said that we could ride that for the same price as a taxi. Well, if we wanted a shuttle we would have asked for one, or at least expected a price break since there were multiple passengers. The shuttle arrived, but there wasn't enough room since the other family had 10+ pieces of luggage. The front desk worker than ordered is a taxi 10 or so minutes after we requested to have one. Thankfully traffic and security at the airport wasn't bad and we made it in time. The only nice thing I can say is the room was comfortable and clean. Pool and whirlpool was small but okay. There was no options for restraunts in the area. You either had to eat at their little cafe or purchase from their store at absorbant prices, if you did't take the shuttle somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay......too far out”
Reviews.Author: heavenlycreation2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for four nights. Yes, its fairly new hotel, but it is not warm or inviting. It is far out down an industrial area with nothing around it for miles. Conveniently near the turnpike. The older lady at the front desk with the bleached blond hair was very rude to me, she alerted me that I was not charged for my room. So she was about to double charge me before she realized her error and kinda/slightly apologized. She then proceeded to hold $40 on my cc for "incidentals. Very cold this one, I thk she is the manager. The lobby is nice. They have a business area, but when I tried to print something it didnt work and no one know how to fix it, so that was a bummer. I ordered a hamburger from my room, came down stairs after 30mins and only to find out they never put it in. Btw, went I finally got it, it was very good even tho they gave me chips instead of fries. Later, that night I order their "starbucks" coffee, and proceeded to get the worst cup of coffee Ive had in twenty years.....they should not serve starbuck products if they do have the machinery or expertise. The room was new, and well appointed. Everything look clean, and I did sleep well. The hotel is far for anything so keep that in mind, Overall, my stay was ok, nothing spectactular, I would recommend it for a short stay, but the toll fee will kill your pockets if you plan to go to any of the sights....and they hold my 40 bucks for over a week .....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Labor Day Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: mindelicious
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights over labor day weekend. The aaa rate was only $64 for a king room. This Marriott is obviously brand new. The rooms were gorgeous and very stylish. The staff was very friendly. We only had one problem while there. We hung the "do not disturb" on the door so the housekeeper wouldn't come in to clean (when only staying a night or two I don't see the need in taking two pieces of trash out and new towels), and when got back from a Marlins game there was a housekeeper in the room. She didn't speak a lick of english and we don't speak any Spanish so she had to call down to the front desk to have the front desk girl tell us that the housekeeper would like us to wait outside for five minutes while she finished. I said I had the "DND" on the door when we left and she apologized for the mix-up. I have no problem with her being in there. I'm assuming it was a simple misunderstanding, but when she got back on the phone and the front desk girl told her what had happened she threw fresh towels on the vanity and slammed the door. It was extremely rude considering it was, I'm assuming, an accident. Other than that our stay was wonderful. If you have breakfast at the bistro get the breakfast quesadilla. It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from this brand new Courtyard. The hotel is brand new with a really nice lobby and very modern. The rooms are very nicely decorated with a flat panel TV and a nice decor. The beds I have to say were a bit on the hard side and the sheets were not great. But other than that, it is a very nice place to stay for an overnight. There is not much to do in the area where the hotel is located though, and no restaurants nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Miami West/FL Turnpike
HotelInfo.Address: 11580 NW 105th St, Miami, FL 33178
